channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: “They are trying to cover something up,” said a neighbor who lives across from Robb Elementary and was confused why police didn’t immediately enter upon arrival. “I think the cops were waiting for backup because they didn’t want to go into the school.” https://t.co/5ISAwrTuFE

Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell threw his support behind bipartisan talks on legislation to address mass shootings, following the deaths of 19 children and two teachers at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas https://t.co/cMwsY3gwqK
The Justice Department won’t charge FBI agents who disregarded Olympic gymnasts’ complaints of sexual assault by Larry Nassar and lied to cover their mistakes https://t.co/WkfaSxbI5a

Michigan election officials disqualified five Republican candidates vying to unseat Gov. Gretchen Whitmer this fall after an investigation found they had filed tens of thousands of forged signatures to get on the ballot https://t.co/4ZLqma1JQ0

“Abbott Elementary” star and creator Quinta Brunson is turning down requests from fans to make an episode about a school shooting, saying she believes it is misguided for entertainers rather than politicians to address gun violence https://t.co/Yh3g2KhHXk

The Palestinian Authority said an investigation concluded that an Israeli soldier deliberately shot and killed a Palestinian-American reporter covering an Israeli raid in the West Bank, a finding that Israel’s defense minister immediately denied https://t.co/vQvLUYkygX
“Goodfellas” actor Ray Liotta has died at 67 https://t.co/1CS5NhPpQo
The Uvalde gunman fired shots outside the school for 12 minutes before walking in, Texas officials said, laying out a new timeline of the attack https://t.co/9T4bZBv0i0

Frantic parents urged police to enter Robb Elementary School in Uvalde as the attack was unfolding, videos on social media show. Residents have questioned the time it took law enforcement to end the shooting. https://t.co/hR7YHGV7fI

A New York state appeals court ruled that former President Donald Trump and two of his adult children must testify under oath as part of the New York attorney general’s civil-fraud investigation into the Trump family business https://t.co/c0WZ7eTLfE
Actor Kevin Spacey was charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men in the U.K., according to British prosecutors https://t.co/CTtrmU0tmf
From @WSJopinion: Salvador Ramos, the Uvalde school shooter, was a troubled soul. But we are a disturbed society, writes Lance Morrow https://t.co/zKV5vePxzr

Senate Republicans are expected to block debate on a bill that would establish new domestic terrorism offices in the wake of a shooting that killed 10 Black people at a Buffalo, N.Y., supermarket https://t.co/mrmGn9RtOU

More than 1,000 people from Uvalde leaned into their faith as they gathered to listen to pastors offer messages of strength and salvation just 30 hours after a man shot and killed 19 children and two teachers in an elementary school https://t.co/4nyCfo7uL4
Broadcom agreed to buy software company VMware in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $61 billion, in what would be one of the year’s biggest deals https://t.co/U2OlsvsHxe
Uvalde, Texas, feels like the only topic worth talking about right now, writes sports columnist @JasonGay https://t.co/BSvZzegqgA

Texas Gov. Greg Abbott dismissed calls for more gun regulation following the mass shooting in Uvalde: “I hate to say this, but there are more people shot every weekend in Chicago than there are in schools in Texas." https://t.co/WPuECvv2fX
New York lost hundreds of thousands of people during the year that ended July 1, 2021, as it and other big U.S. cities saw residents flee for more space and cheaper housing https://t.co/NEQHKyd4Zs

Russian Orthodox Church leader Patriarch Kirill has been a key Putin ally, promoting the view of a "holy struggle against the West" to millions of faithful. The EU is considering sanctioning him. https://t.co/FXI3OyychC

Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott donated $122.6 million to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, the organization said Tuesday, in the largest donation from one person in the group’s history https://t.co/AEG9ZCb3lJ
Oklahoma’s governor has signed the toughest abortion ban in effect in the U.S., outlawing the procedure at any stage of pregnancy and enforced by citizens https://t.co/dmaYrGGDuA

The Walt Disney Co. has become entangled in a corruption scandal unfolding in Anaheim, the southern California city where its Disneyland Resort is based, that this week prompted its mayor to resign https://t.co/enCt8n4igC
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/HmOy54Ewad https://t.co/12WPr7vn2y
The top 50 richest people in the world, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates, have lost more than half a trillion dollars on paper this year https://t.co/FDE8zi1ml2

Republicans on the House Oversight Committee are laying the groundwork for a probe into Hunter Biden’s finances, part of efforts to keep the president’s son in the spotlight ahead of midterm elections https://t.co/eg973dCeNS

The Border Patrol agent who killed the Uvalde elementary school shooter belonged to a small, elite team that has a presence in the Texas town and responded to calls about the incident on local police radio https://t.co/iwjESiCyqp
The school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, that left at least 21 dead was the deadliest at a U.S. school since the slaughter at Sandy Hook Elementary. Here's what we know so far. https://t.co/h8C3X5HZ80
Apple is boosting starting pay for hourly U.S. workers to $22 an hour amid rising inflation and a tight labor market https://t.co/TFKxhCH3vP

Natural-gas exporter Venture Global LNG said it would build a new, multibillion-dollar liquefied natural-gas export facility in Louisiana, as demand for U.S. gas exports surges in Europe following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/JwdptFjTCW
Oklahoma’s governor has signed the toughest abortion ban in effect in the U.S., outlawing the procedure at any stage of pregnancy and enforced by citizens https://t.co/aTQ4OAOIv2
A federal judge on Wednesday dismissed a gun-industry challenge to a New York law that allows firearm manufacturers and sellers to be sued over gun violence in the state https://t.co/shcC9cUkb8

Families of the 19 children and two teachers killed in the Uvalde, Texas, shooting are sharing who their loved ones were: “She was my sweet baby. She loved Alfredo pasta and wanted ice cream after every meal.” https://t.co/3J63ezScIi

Texas Gov. Greg Abbott dismissed calls for more gun regulation following the mass shooting in Uvalde: “I hate to say this, but there are more people shot every weekend in Chicago than there are in schools in Texas." https://t.co/dTLk0Zke5B

The Walt Disney Co. has become entangled in a corruption scandal unfolding in Anaheim, the southern California city where its Disneyland Resort is based, that this week prompted its mayor to resign https://t.co/fkrwNmuEgl
Elon Musk's plan to finance his Twitter deal now includes $33.5 billion in equity, up from $27.25 billion, amid a sharp decline in Tesla stock https://t.co/nKyrnTMCbK

The Border Patrol agent who killed the Uvalde elementary school shooter belonged to a small, elite team that has a presence in the Texas town and responded to calls about the incident on local police radio https://t.co/wj2fVUbSKL

The support of Patriarch Kirill, leader of the Russian Orthodox Church, could be a crucial legitimating factor for Vladimir Putin as the army he ordered into Ukraine stalls in its invasion https://t.co/GbxarrdNPN

Colin Kaepernick is scheduled to work out for the Las Vegas Raiders this week, a person familiar with the matter said, the first known time that a team has offered him a tryout since his NFL career was halted in the wake of player protests he initiated https://t.co/8myrLWYyuJ
Former Trump White House press secretary Sarah Sanders has easily secured the Republican nomination for governor in Arkansas, according to a projection by the Associated Press https://t.co/cxX8myVPER
Texas Democratic gubernatorial candidate Beto O'Rourke interrupted a news conference held by Gov. Greg Abbott to discuss the school shooting in Uvalde https://t.co/Do0Y7llQrR

From @WSJopinion: If Putin won’t yield, the civilized world, led by the U.S., will have to find a way to break his Ukraine food blockade. A Black Sea mission to escort commercial ships may be needed. https://t.co/mmFjXGYJpe

From @WSJopinion: “The inherent purpose of a gun is to kill. An item whose sole purpose is bloodshed does not deserve the protection of the Constitution,” writes Max Willner-Giwerc, a student at the University of Chicago Law School https://t.co/t7osffIaJk
All 21 victims of the Texas elementary school massacre were in one classroom, where the shooter barricaded himself, a law-enforcement official said https://t.co/pYWtzfwPPd

Golden State Warriors Head Coach Steve Kerr made an emotional plea for gun reform before his team’s NBA playoff game Tuesday against the Dallas Mavericks. “I am tired of the moments of silence. Enough!” https://t.co/CHm9j4bQxY

Comedian Ricky Gervais is under fire after he made graphic jokes about the transgender community in his new Netflix special, prompting social-media backlash and calls for people to boycott the streaming service https://t.co/cMQuLEGHM6
The U.K. approved a deal to sell Chelsea FC, previously owned by Roman Abramovich, to a group led by Los Angeles Dodgers' Todd Boehly https://t.co/DGY5ocyTLS
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/dJWFTeALR6 https://t.co/C0mLGoWxa0

President Biden and the leaders of Japan, India and Australia agreed to joint monitoring of ships in the Indo-Pacific region—a move aimed at China—but didn’t collectively condemn Russia for invading Ukraine https://t.co/AafGQe6hqK

Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott donated $122.6 million to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, the organization said Tuesday, in the largest donation from one person in the group’s history https://t.co/Yknpx8VUMR
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/O9qPzx44UY https://t.co/LApZgDfvml
